member.name: T:CMS.Core.AppCore
member.summary: Main entry point to the application.

member.name: P:CMS.Core.AppCore.PreInitialized
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the application core has been pre-initialized.

member.name: P:CMS.Core.AppCore.Initialized
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the application core has been initialized.

member.name: M:CMS.Core.AppCore.PreInit
member.summary: Determines whether the pre-initialization phase of the application core life-cycle is complete. If it is not, it executes it.

remarks.para: This method is not intended to be used in custom code. Use CMS.DataEngine.CMSApplication.PreInit() instead.

A loop in application core pre-initialization is typically caused by some module's pre-initialization code trying to perform actions which require the application core to be already pre-initialized. Module's pre-initialization must never rely on such actions.

member.returns: True, the pre-initialization phase of the application core life-cycle has been executed; otherwise, false.
member.exception: Thrown when a loop occurs in application core pre-initialization.

member.name: M:CMS.Core.AppCore.Init
member.summary: Determines whether the initialization phase of the application core life-cycle is complete. If it is not, it executes it.
member.remarks: This method is not intended to be used in custom code. Use CMS.DataEngine.CMSApplication.Init() instead.
member.returns: True, if the initialization phase of the application core life-cycle has been executed; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:CMS.Core.Lifestyle
member.summary: Enumeration of possible lifestyles of a service registered via .

member.name: F:CMS.Core.Lifestyle.Singleton
member.summary: Singleton lifestyle.

member.name: F:CMS.Core.Lifestyle.Transient
member.summary: Transient lifestyle.

member.name: T:CMS.Core.RegistrationPriority
member.summary: Enumeration of possible priorities for implementation registration.

member.name: F:CMS.Core.RegistrationPriority.Default
member.summary: Indicates that implementation being registered is to replace any implementation registered so far.

member.name: F:CMS.Core.RegistrationPriority.Fallback
member.summary: Indicates that implementation being registered is to be considered a fallback implementation. Such implementation is used only when no other implementation is registered later in the application's life-cycle.

remarks.para: A fallback implementation is typically used during early application initialization phase, when regular system implementation is yet to be registered.
Registering more than one fallback implementation is an error and the behavior is undefined.

member.name: F:CMS.Core.RegistrationPriority.SystemDefault
member.summary: Indicates that implementation being registered is to be considered a system default implementation. implementation has precedence when registering an implementation.
member.remarks: Registering more than one system default implementation is an error and the behavior is undefined.

member.summary: Provides loading of application assemblies.

member.summary: The full name of the AssemblyDiscoverableAttribute class.

member.name: F:CMS.Core.AssemblyDiscovery.mExcludedFileNames
member.summary: A set of file names that will be excluded from discovery.

member.name: P:CMS.Core.AssemblyDiscovery.Assemblies
member.summary: A list of application assemblies.

member.name: P:CMS.Core.AssemblyDiscovery.DiscoverableAssemblies
member.summary: A list of discoverable application assemblies.

member.name: M:CMS.Core.AssemblyDiscovery.GetAssemblies(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns an enumerable collection of application assemblies.
member.param: A value indicating whether the discovery process will locate only assemblies decorated with the attribute.
member.remarks:
The discovery process looks for assemblies in the directories that the assembly resolver probes. By default, all the application assemblies are returned, but there are exceptions.
If the is set to true, assemblies without the attribute are excluded from discovery.
If there is a file with the "exclude" extension, for example MyCustomAssembly.dll.exclude, the MyCustomAssembly.dll is excluded from discovery.
Assemblies from the GAC are always excluded from discovery.
member.returns: An enumerable collection of application assemblies.

member.name: M:CMS.Core.AssemblyDiscovery.GetAssembliesFilePaths
member.summary: Returns an enumerable collection of file paths to all assemblies in the directories that the assembly resolver probes.
member.remarks: The assembly resolver probes for assemblies in the application directory. If the application setup includes a list of search paths relative to the application directory, the assembly resolver probes for assemblies only in the specified subdirectories. A web application is a good example as its setup includes a relative path to the bin subfolder.
member.returns: An enumerable collection of file paths to all assemblies in the directories that the assembly resolver probes.

member.summary: Returns true if the given assembly is discoverable.

summary.para: Makes the implementation of type represented by this registration current default. This overrides any previous registrations.

member.summary: The module entry has been processed.

member.summary: The module entry is being processed.
